org.jetel.lookup

Class DBLookupTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.graph.GraphElement
      • org.jetel.lookup.DBLookupTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<DataRecord>, LookupTable, IGraphElement

    public class DBLookupTable
extends GraphElement
implements LookupTable
    Database table/SQLquery based lookup table which gets data by performing SQL query. Caching of found values can be provided - if the constructor with numCached parameter is used. The XML DTD describing the internal structure is as follows: * <!ATTLIST LookupTable id ID #REQUIRED type NMTOKEN (DBLookup) #REQUIRED metadata CDATA #REQUIRED sqlQuery CDATA #REQUIRED dbConnection CDATA #REQUIRED maxCached CDATA #IMPLIED> storeNulls CDATA #IMPLIED>
    Since:
    May 22, 2003

      • preExecute

        public void preExecute()
                throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This is also initialization method, which is invoked before each separate graph run. That is, it can be invoked multiple times. Use IGraphElement.firstRun() to determine whether given invocation is the first one. Contrary to the IGraphElement.init() procedure, this method should allocate only resources for this single graph run. All resources allocated in this method should be released in the IGraphElement.postExecute() method.
        Specified by:
        preExecute in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        preExecute in class GraphElement
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - some of the required resource is not available or other precondition is not accomplish

      • postExecute

        public void postExecute()
                 throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This is de-initialization method for a single graph run. All resources allocated in IGraphElement.preExecute() method should be released here. It is guaranteed that this method is invoked after graph finish at the latest. For some graph elements, for instance components, is this method called immediately after phase finish.
        Specified by:
        postExecute in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Description copied from interface: LookupTable

        Attempts to free memory by erasing internal caches of the lookup table.

        Behavior in different LookupTable implementations can differ and can give different results. Clearing the caches may result in LookupTable having no entries, for other implementations it might only result in higher memory available after the LookupTable is cleared, and worse performance once the LookupTable is used again.

        Specified by:
        clear in interface LookupTable

      • free

        public void free()
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This is de-initialization method for this graph element. All resources allocated in IGraphElement.init() method should be released here. This method is invoked only once at the end of this graph element existence.
        Specified by:
        free in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:

      • checkConfig

        public ConfigurationStatus checkConfig(ConfigurationStatus status)
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        Checks the configuration of this graph element. This method should verify that all required parameters are set and that the element can be used. This method might be called before graph execution, in such case it will be called before the IGraphElement.init() method. It is not guaranteed that this method will ever be called, but also this method may be called repeatedly. All resources allocated in this method should be freed in this method too.

      • createLookup

        public Lookup createLookup(RecordKey key)
                    throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: LookupTable

        Creates a lookup proxy object for the given lookup key. Returned proxy object can be used to retrieve data records associated with the given lookup key via the Iterator<DataRecord> interface. Lookup proxy object can also be used for continuous searching based on the same key and different data records.

        Specified by:
        createLookup in interface LookupTable
        Parameters:
        key - a record key that will be used for lookup
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - if the lookup table is not properly configured
        See Also:
        Lookup

      • createLookup

        public Lookup createLookup(RecordKey key,
                  DataRecord keyRecord)
                    throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: LookupTable

        Creates a lookup proxy object for the given lookup key. Returned proxy object can be used to retrieve data records associated with the given lookup key via the Iterator<DataRecord> interface. Lookup proxy object can also be used for continuous searching based on the same key and different data records.

        A lookup table implementation can take advantage of the second parameter to prepare a lookup query that can be reused by simple refilling the specified instance of the DataRecord class.

        Specified by:
        createLookup in interface LookupTable
        Parameters:
        key - a record key that will be used for lookup
        keyRecord - a data record that will be used for future lookup queries
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - if the lookup table is not properly configured
        See Also:
        Lookup

      • getKeyMetadata

        public DataRecordMetadata getKeyMetadata()
                                  throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: LookupTable

        Returns metadata used to create the lookup proxy object by calling any of the LookupTable.createLookup(RecordKey) or LookupTable.createLookup(RecordKey, DataRecord) methods.

        Specified by:
        getKeyMetadata in interface LookupTable
        Returns:
        metadata that is used for joining records
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - if the lookup table is not properly configured

      • put

        public boolean put(DataRecord dataRecord)
        Description copied from interface: LookupTable

        Specified by:
        put in interface LookupTable
        Parameters:
